name: Overview
data:
[{"id":"7984c57a-558e-4c51-9354-62b60ce8016c","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"File Overview: ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"returns.py","styles":{"code":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"63c40f26-e460-4cc6-83a6-ce635140b596","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"returns","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" module is a specialized tracking component within the Jarvis analysis engine. Its primary purpose is to maintain a registry of "return relationships"—specifically mapping where values originate (the source function) and where they are assigned (the destination variables) across different namespaces.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"6c0bd2c1-b767-475b-b0d8-8af3199a8fba","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"As a static or dynamic analysis tool moves through code, it needs to remember that a variable in one scope is actually the result of a function call from another scope. This file provides the infrastructure to bridge those boundaries.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"a6a2427c-90af-40e3-af25-ca785a067657","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"92062383-5f77-432e-9afd-858ba0679a32","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Core Purpose and Role","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"33d59f77-a061-4a86-a294-333a55c828e7","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"In a complex system like Jarvis, understanding data flow is critical. The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"returns","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" module serves as the "memory" for function output propagation:","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"b28b8c19-a78a-4786-98bc-1aaae2269815","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Origin Tracking","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": It records the specific line number and namespace where a return value was generated.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"2d397cf6-37e6-4e21-8faf-6c3fda93d620","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Cross-Boundary Mapping","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": It links the "Right-Hand Side" (the function being called) to the "Left-Hand Side" (the variable receiving the data).","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"1eedb3fa-9262-4360-b64d-a9ffdf073237","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"State Management","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": It allows the analyzer to "peek" at upcoming return values or "pop" them once the relationship has been successfully processed and linked in the global model.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"489b2afb-662b-48b8-ab00-5299eb404c2a","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"c6bf2e4a-d794-43d8-9d65-2937170a27b5","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Key Components","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"18c247da-4ce3-47e5-ac3b-901d7218308f","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"ReturnManager","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (The Orchestrator)","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"7136c6db-4f37-4b9e-9fb0-2ce146f0e7e7","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The central authority of the file. It maintains a dictionary-based storage system where the keys are namespaces (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"currentNs","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":") and the values are lists of recorded return events. It handles the lifecycle of a return record, from initial discovery to final consumption.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"960a3064-0b54-4b39-bd5e-dada18a82e6b","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"ReturnItem","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (The Data Model)","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"15e05dad-1e72-4535-8f59-ad91672a2177","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"A lightweight container that represents a single link in the data-flow chain. It encapsulates three critical pieces of metadata:","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"a073e024-1635-412f-90ac-2c1d60305ec5","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Left","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": The target identifier receiving the value.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"867aea64-75d0-4723-a567-a3ef1b08ba1f","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Row","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": The source code line where the return occurs.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"8a74f7c8-2da7-42a8-a232-ad9e5bf32d0e","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Right","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": The source function or namespace providing the value.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"98bfe479-ed46-4877-ac9e-37c36102a017","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"f008939b-d57f-48d4-b6fc-5ccdd5f9b1d7","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"System Integration & Relationship","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"e7f8a32b-4d19-47f2-86cc-5c8055472d0e","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ReturnManager","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" acts as a middleman between the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Parser/Analyzer","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Global Symbol Table","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":":","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"d12ee16f-5ac7-4f41-be8d-8e829642741b","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Input","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": While analyzing a function body, the analyzer encounters a ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"return","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" statement or a function call assignment and registers it here using ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"add_returnitem","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"0c65edfe-ae52-4973-8298-63e5a113b1ce","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Output","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": When the system needs to resolve the value of a variable that was assigned via a function call, it queries the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ReturnManager","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" using ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"peek_returnItem","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" or ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"pop_returnItem","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to find the original source.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"ceeb2a6c-917d-4d51-b0a6-8992d3f69e08","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"391ddb94-e231-418e-8ec1-b238c4f3f62d","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Brief Insight / Tutorial","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"ca3acda6-91aa-4d99-9f7e-69a3ca6d9ab2","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"To use the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ReturnManager","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" within the analysis flow, you typically follow a ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Register-and-Resolve","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" pattern.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"e0ea95f2-bdb1-4515-98ee-b8f6930791c8","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"1. Registering a Return Relationship","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"f35bb2cb-fb8e-4fc6-9729-d6f6213d4130","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"When the analyzer encounters code like ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"x = get_data()","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" at line 10, you notify the manager:","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"fd7397e1-9e5c-418b-98c7-3eec884a4c4e","type":"codeBlock","props":{"language":"python"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"# Assuming current namespace is 'main_script'
# 'x' is the left side, 10 is the row, 'api.get_data' is the right side
manager.add_returnitem("main_script", "x", 10, "api.get_data")","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"ffb70933-b006-4bbd-8948-bf45618b6e72","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"2. Inspecting the State","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"d6ec1b71-be73-4c00-ab7d-ed27a92f7d11","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"You can check what returns are currently pending for a specific namespace to debug the analysis flow:","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"86b4e8be-1c4d-40ec-80d4-399e500194d6","type":"codeBlock","props":{"language":"python"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"pending_returns = manager.get_returnitem("main_script")","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"1becd1fc-6dd7-4780-a61a-bb035e15d827","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"3. Resolving the Relationship","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"ab599857-5115-40ec-bfcc-23c4b54f22db","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Once the analyzer confirms that the value has been passed back, you "pop" the item. This retrieves the variable name and removes it from the tracking queue, signifying the data flow is complete:","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"5580bc4a-0c82-4752-a2d8-15da8c288b71","type":"codeBlock","props":{"language":"python"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"var_name = manager.pop_returnItem("main_script", 10, "api")
print(f"Variable '{var_name}' was updated by the return from 'api'")","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"80ec2315-298b-41f8-b192-36d37d2b8a72","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"This mechanism ensures that Jarvis can accurately trace how data moves from a low-level utility function all the way up to high-level application logic.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"7a9189f7-1b27-4f5b-aeae-eea7f60dae08","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[],"children":[]}]
